Ethnologue > Web version > Country index > Americas > Peru > Huitoto, Murui

Huitoto, Murui

A language of Peru

ISO 639-3: huu

Population  1,000 in Peru (1995 SIL), decreasing. Very few monolinguals. Population total all countries: 7,800.
Region  Northeast Peru, southwest Colombia. Ampiyacu, Putumayo, and Napo rivers; north of Amazon River between Iquitos, Peru and Leticia, Colombia on the south, Caquetá River north. Also in Colombia.
Language map  Peru, reference number 52
Alternate names   Bue, Witoto
Dialects  Mica.
Classification  Witotoan, Witoto, Witoto Proper, Minica-Murui
Language use  Official language. Shifting to Spanish. Recognized by Peruvian government for use in schools. Written and oral use in religious services. More prestigious in Colombia than in Peru. Also use Spanish. A few also speak Bora [boa].
Language development  Literacy rate in L1: Below 1%. Literacy rate in L2: 15%–25%. 95% of those under 40 are literate. Dictionary. Grammar. NT: 1978.
Writing system  Latin script.
Comments  SOV. Christian, traditional religion.

Also spoken in:

Colombia

Language name   Huitoto, Murui
Population  6,800 in Colombia (2002).
Region  Caraparana, Putumayo, and Leticia rivers.
Language map  Southern Colombia
Alternate names  Bue, Witoto
 

Entries from the SIL Bibliography about this language:

Academic Publications

Burtch, Bryan and Mary Ruth Wise. 1968. "Murui (Witotoan) clause structures."

Burtch, Bryan and Shirley Burtch. 1975. "Huitoto muruí: Bosquejo breve de la subsistencia y terminología muruí de parentesco."  

Burtch, Bryan, compiler. 1985, 2008. Textos Murui.  

Burtch, Bryan. 1975. "Fonología del idioma huitoto muruí."  

Burtch, Shirley, compiler. 1983. Diccionario huitoto murui.  

Nies, Joyce, compiler. 1976, 2008. Suplemento A: listas comparativas de palabras usuales en idiomas vernaculos de la selva.  

Sparing, Margarethe and others. 1976, 2008. Instrumentos musicales tradicionales de varios grupos de la selva Peruana.  

Various authors. 1975. Datos Etno-Lingüísticos 9.  

Waterhouse, Viola G., editor. 1963. Studies in Peruvian Indian languages 1.
